intro: Clibadium peruvianum, commonly known as the Peruvian sida, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
